intro: Sambucus phyteumoides, commonly known as the Chinese elderberry, is a species of shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often arranged in a whorled pattern along the stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, followed by red or black berries that are edible when ripe. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The berries are used in traditional medicine and culinary practices in its native regions.
